DOMImplementation.summary: The DOMImplementation interface represents an object providing methods which are not dependent on any particular document. Such an object is returned by the property.

DOMImplementationCreateDocument.summary:
The DOMImplementation.createDocument() method creates and
returns an .

DOMImplementationCreateDocumentType.summary:
The DOMImplementation.createDocumentType() method returns
a object which can either be used with
upon document creation or can be put
into the document via methods like or
.

DOMImplementationCreateHTMLDocument.summary:
The
DOMImplementation.createHTMLDocument() method creates a
new HTML .

DOMImplementationHasFeature.summary:
IMPORTANT Deprecated The
DOMImplementation.hasFeature() method returns a
boolean flag indicating if a given feature is supported. It is
deprecated and modern browsers return true in all cases.

remarks.para:
The different implementations fairly diverged in what kind of features were reported.
The latest version of the spec settled to force this method to always return
true, where the functionality was accurate and in use.
